items.title: Getting a new rucksack for travelling
items.content_html: I am thinking of getting a Goruck GR2. I am in love with their rucksacks, and since 2011 the GR1 has been my daily “go to work” ruck, and I also use it for occasional travelling. Now I will be travelling a bit more, and for trips of 1+ weeks, the GR1 is just a wee bit too small. It is an expensive piece of gear, but I know first hand that their gear is of top quality, comfortable to carry, easy to pack and durable. A little bird told me that around 4 July there will be a sale, so I will be holding my horses until then.

Seems like my iPad is terminally ill with battery problems. However, it will be replaced by a new unit, and I’ll just pay for the battery. Better than I had hoped for given that the warranty period expired a couple of months ago. The new unit carries a new 2 year warranty.
My iPad is in hospital, so I am finding myself using pen and paper a lot more. While I miss the iPad, it is nice to use analog tools more.

I have a strange relationship with coffee. I crave every cup, but very rarely do I get one that makes me think, “Oh this is good!”.

However, when I do, it is divine.

It is like a little lottery. Will I win today?

“My” football team, SK Brann, won the national championship in 1962, 1963 and 2007. They are currently on top of the league table. Still a long way to go, but there is the glimmer of hope for a fourth title.
My agenda/diary. A Hobonichi Techo with a YELLOW cover.

You know a company has some way to go in the HR area when the first two reactions from management after you resign is 1) you can’t use your holiday days, and 2) can you extend your notice period by one month?
I’m going to Munich for two weeks in July. It is one of my favorite cities.
Wine in its early stage
Relaxation

The less pleasant part of changing jobs is informing the current employer that you want to leave, particularly in a small company. That tricky part out of the way, I can now take a deep breath and prepare for the new one.
I have started brushing up on my almost forgotten German.
Morning bliss
Reading Sophie Lovell’s book Dieter Rams: As Little Design as Possible. Much food for thought.
Since there seems to be quite a few pen geeks here, you might like to know that Cult Pens in the UK are offering free international shipping on orders over GBP 50.
Stephen Fry’s Mythos dropped from 30-something dollars down to roughly 10 on the Kindle store, so I got it today.
Getting more and more tempted to get an AlphaSmart keyboard. In a way it feels like a step on the way to a typewriter.

Some months ago I spent a pretty penny on an iPad stand from Yohann. I thought at the time the purchase was a bit extravagant, but the stand has turned out to be a wonderful investment. I love it and use it all the time. At the desk, sitting in a chair, or in bed. Top marks!
For whatever reason I haven’t listened to David Sylvian in a long, long time. I am remedying that situation today.
“Spellbound” by Siouxsie and the Banshees continues to spellbind me.
Found this in a local shop today. It brought back memories of all-nighters from my student days.
One thing I have noticed since getting an Apple watch is that the phone is using a lot more power. I rarely get a full days with of usage without charging.
I guess UEFA Champions League is not huge in the micro.blog community, but to anyone following the game, Cheers!
Preparing for football tonight. Guess which is my team.
I love this stuff
